name: places/ChIJ1QCl_flYwokRkl7QIHvD8dk
formattedAddress: 100 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 100 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019-3328, USA

editorialSummary.text: Drugstore chain with health & beauty aids, prescriptions & photo services, plus mini-mart basics.

originalText.text:
Absolutely inefficient. Don’t know if staff is busy or slow. Took 20+ minutes to print a form with my name before vaccination and then another 10 minutes to administer the shot. No other customer attended to in the meantime at least at the counter. Had same experience with my wife’s vaccination on Monday. Actual shot took less than 30 seconds.
Someone (probably manager) asked me if I was being helped and the staff immediately responded that we are working on him!!!

originalText.text: A sub-par pharmacy at a prime location.  Many items are stored in secure boxes and service is a little slow and inefficient.   Prices are on the high side.  Recommended only for quick and unavoidable stops.  The service at the cash register should be improved.

text.text: A sub-par pharmacy at a prime location.  Many items are stored in secure boxes and service is a little slow and inefficient.   Prices are on the high side.  Recommended only for quick and unavoidable stops.  The service at the cash register should be improved.

originalText.text:
This location has unwanted medication drop-off!!
Had my vaccination and flu shot there. The person who gave me the shot gave over 6000 shots so he was super experienced and quick.

originalText.text: Would give 0 stars if I could for withholding anti-inflammatory meds despite ~8 total attempts to pick up. FIrst rx end of April, filled but refused to give to me x 1 month so just as in the store, then put back on shelf, made me wait an additional month and tried to blame me “that I didn’t pick it up” (I’m in ~1x per week for all my other scripts). THEN AGAIN Went to pick up all prescriptions before leaving for a trip 2 weeks ago. Again never refilled them, DESPITE ALSO RENEWED PRESCRIPTION FROM THE MD. Went two weeks with a flare up, just to return to the states and find out they “filled it” never gave it to me (I’m literally in there once a week) and now today are closed and I cannot pick up elsewhere today.

originalText.text: Thought my first unpleasant encounter here was a fluke so brushed it off even though the cashier tall black female with her hair in a bun was rude when I asked a question about my prescription but now my new experience with the older black short haired lady is a common theme on poor leadership in their pharmacy. I don’t know who hires these chip on shoulder types but I felt discriminated upon and won’t be returning.
